title: Hot Fudge Roasted Potatoes

author.name: Peter Fitzpatrick
author.note: Peter is the author of NYT best seller "Fudgy Surprises."

description: This charming pile of carbs and sugar smells as offensive as it looks; a repelling surprise for any unruly guest! Despite its appearance it's actually delicious if you can must the courage to try it.

photo.description: A steaming pile of fudgy potatoes

instructions: For the roasted potatoes, preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Rinse the potatoes, pat dry, and cut into 1/2 inch cubes.
Place in a bowl, coat with oil, and toss.
Spread evenly on a baking sheet  and bake for 30 minutes, turning half way through.
Place on two paper plates and coat with fudge.
For the hot fudge, cut fudge into 1/2 inch cubes
Place fudge cubes in small sauce pan and heat on low, stirring vigorously
Keep stirring until the potatoes are done.

sidebars.label: Chef's Tips
content:
- Try not to eat all the fudge prior to preparing this dish
- Potatoes are sometimes dirty
- This is a really confusing dish for children and the elderly
- They call it hot fudge for a reason. Be careful!
